item.description: Working Experience NoMachine Tbilisi, Georgia C/C++ Developer: July 2014 - October 2018 Worked on various modules of the application, mostly related to network programming. Integrated WebRTC Project. Lead a small team of 3. Bolt Software Engineer: October 2018 - August 2020 Scooters team: Designed and implemented scooters-related microservices in Node.js and Typescript. Platform team: Built a fully functional Alerting solution, integrating with various data sources.

KATU Source code KATU is a tool that I developed for my Master’s Thesis in TU Kaiserslautern. It detects unbounded memory accesses in applications. To achieve it, the tool keeps track of memory regions that contain data that an app has read from somewhere (this is called a tainted data). It also keeps track of boundary checks that got applied to that data. By having this information, the tool can detect if a memory address that depends on an unbounded tainted data gets accessed.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a Senior Software Engineer, currently working at Bolt.
